recordings.loc: J.N. "Ding" Darling National Wildlife Refuge (near  Sanibel), Lee County, Florida
Edgewater, Volusia County, Florida
recordings.type: call, drumming, Kwirr, drumming on ceramic telephone equipment
recordings.rmk: Unmodified recording. Dawn on cooler than usual morning. Bird oriented with breast towards east, although head turned through full range of motion during recording. Each time it made Kwirr call, it extended its neck and the feathers became more erect on neck and head. Drumming was consistently on a ceramic covering on the telephone pole and was usually about 18 notes/second. Kwirr calls were single and in series up to 6 at a time. Variation in number of Kwirrs and of drums did not seem to be random. For instance, at 1:26 an answering drum can be heard and again at 1:28, which resulted in a series of  6 Kwirrs, the maximum length. Also when bird was about to fly at end of recording, there was an unusual pattern of Kwirrs: 5, 5, 4, 4 all within 50 seconds followed by a series of 7 drums in 1 min.30 sec., then 2 Kwirrs before it took off. When a distant Red-shouldered Hawk called, woodpecker was silent and looked around before resuming.
recordings.dvc: Sound Devices MIXPRE3, Classic Softie Windshield

recordings.loc: North Shore Boat Launch, Escanaba, Wells Township (near  Wells), Delta County, Michigan
recordings.rmk: Unmodified recording. Bird mostly hidden among crowded branches and leaves in woods adjacent to the boardwalk, but seen when it flew while making the last 8 call notes on the recording. Bird appeared to be alone. Heavy rain earlier in the day which had ceased only a short time before this recording was made. Wind was calm, temperature was falling, about 50 degrees F. Other birds in vicinity were an American Crow (cawing a few notes on the recording), a Bald Eagle perched in tree on opposite side of Escanaba River which boardwalk fronts, Song Sparrows and Ring-billed Gulls.
recordings.dvc: Sound Devices MIXPRE3, Classic Softie Windshield

recordings.loc: Goethe State Park, Levy County, Florida

recordings.loc: Audubon Corkscrew Swamp sanctuary, Naples, Collier County, Florida
recordings.rmk: 3 Red-bellied Woodpeckers present, flying and calling, landing briefly in several different trees, but staying at least 20 feet up.  Sound agitated. Joined by Carolina Wrens, first the female at about 40 seconds, and then the male at about 1:06. At the time, I thought one of the woodpeckers might have been an interloper interfering in a mated pair, but listening to the audio, it seems more likely that a predator was nearby and was disturbing not only the woodpeckers but also the wrens. A Red-shouldered Hawk had been heard briefly (on my previous recording done about 1minute earlier) and might have remained in the vicinity, and there were plenty of opportunities for other predators to be hiding in the thick tropical plant tangles.

recordings.loc: Audubon Corkscrew Swamp Sanctuary, Naples, Collier County, Florida
recordings.rmk: Recorded from boardwalk in sanctuary. Several Red-bellied Woodpeckers were flying around, landing on trunks and branches of cypress trees, while calling loudly and drumming occasionally. More than one kind of call recorded (Wik-a and Bark). Drumming at 2:27 on recording.  The birds were at least 20 feet up and occasionally more than 50 feet away from microphone.

recordings.rmk: This bird was just off the trail on the northeastern ridge along Colchester Pond. The habitat on the ridge was typical northern hardwood forest, albeit with plenty of vernal pools and rocky outcrops to break up the maples, beeches, and oaks. The day was cloudy at this point, with no precipitation. Lighting was fairly good. I modified this recording by removing handling noise and boosting the volume using Audacity.

recordings.loc: Skidaway Island, Chatham County, GA USA
recordings.rmk: Longish file demonstrating the behavior of a Red-bellied Woodpecker at a potential nesting cavity.  A one or two note call answered by a more distant bird, plus drumming.  This call sequence has been used for the past week or more at this location. The file is a blend of two recordings within seconds of one another to get the drumming.  The cadence is intact with the exception of  brief human interruption and a dog bark.  Normalization to -6dBA  One pass with noise reduction to attenuate the background.

recordings.loc: Skidaway Island, Chatham County, GA USA
recordings.rmk: A Red-bellied Woodpecker calling from in front of a newly enlarged cavity in a dead tree next to a marsh.

recordings.loc: Skidaway Island, Chatham County, GA USA
recordings.rmk: This two minute recording is excerpted from a soundscape recording of birds on a very rare snow day on the coast of Georgia in the Southeastern USA.  The persistence of the vocalizing and drumming, and the sound of other woodpeckers might be interpreted as the beginning of efforts by these species to create breeding territories.

Eufaula, Barbour County, Alabama
Oxford, Lafayette County, Mississippi
recordings.rmk:
Foraging in large trees near the forest edge. Distance from microphone ~15m.

#Habitat#
State waterfowl refuge along the margins of USACE flood control reservoir. Strip along the lake margins ~1km wide of moist soil grassland with mix of forbs, native warm season grasses (Andropogon, Schyzachyrium, Eragrostis, Aristida, etc.), and some sparse woody vegetation (Cephalanthus, Quercus saplings, etc.) bounded by oak hickory forest and, in places, pine plantation.  Three or four shallow waterfowl impoundments partially flooded in the winter.

#Editing#
Edited in Adobe Audition. Butterworth high-pass filter, order 3, cutoff frequency 1 kHz

#Equipment#
Fostex FR-2 digital recorder with Sennheiser microphone and Telinga pro 22" parabolic reflector.

recordings.loc: Minnesota Valley NWR, Old Cedar Ave Bridge, Hennepin, Minnesota
recordings.rmk:
Calls from a bird about 15m up on a trunk of a tree.  It appeared to be sitting next to a potential nest hole and was poking its head inside the hole every now and then.  Overcast and windy. 

Recorded with Olympus LS-10S and Sennheiser ME-66.

Some unfortunate handling noises near the beginning. Filtered low frequencies lightly for wind and traffic.

recordings.rmk: I was watching the bird as it was drumming high up in a tree in my backyard.  I went out on my back porch to get the recording and that's when it started the alarm call. Shortly after it flew away still calling in flight.

recordings.rmk: Target bird was high in a deciduous tree. Mostly drumming and a few calls.  Late in the recording a more distant bird is heard drumming and then calling.
